modules.description: This module provides functions to construct CoAP response messages with specific payloads and metadata. It operates on buffer data to create messages with predefined response codes, such as "not_found" and "content". These functions are used to generate properly formatted CoAP responses for network communication.

The module enables creating, modifying, and inspecting components of CoAP messages, including headers, options, and response codes, while supporting operations to check message properties like confirmability. It handles serialization and deserialization of messages to and from buffers, facilitating efficient request/response handling and communication in resource-constrained IoT environments.

This module defines error types and pretty-printing functionality for handling CoAP protocol errors such as invalid token lengths or option encodings. It includes submodules for constructing, modifying, and serializing CoAP messages, requests, and responses. It is used in IoT applications to manage CoAP communication with precise control over message structure and error handling.
